section.title: Manage images
section.para: When working with images in the SDK, you will call both glance and nova methods.

section.title: List images
section.para: To list the available images, call the glanceclient.v2.images.Controller.list method:
section.programlisting: import glanceclient.v2.client as glclient glance = glclient.Client(...) images = glance.images.list()

section.title: Get image by ID
section.para:
To retrieve an image object from its ID, call the
glanceclient.v2.images.Controller.get method:
section.programlisting: import glanceclient.v2.client as glclient image_id = 'c002c82e-2cfa-4952-8461-2095b69c18a6' glance = glclient.Client(...) image = glance.images.get(image_id)

section.title: Get image by name
section.para: The Image Service Python bindings do not support the retrieval of an image object by name. However, the Compute Python bindings enable you to get an image object by name. To get an image object by name, call the novaclient.v1_1.images.ImageManager.find method:
section.programlisting: import novaclient.v1_1.client as nvclient name = "cirros" nova = nvclient.Client(...) image = nova.images.find(name=name)

section.title: Upload an image
section.para: To upload an image, call the glanceclient.v2.images.ImageManager.create method:
section.programlisting: import glanceclient.v2.client as glclient imagefile = "/tmp/myimage.img" glance = glclient.Client(...) with open(imagefile) as fimage: glance.images.create(name="myimage", is_public=True, disk_format="qcow2", container_format="bare", data=fimage)
